wikipedia_page.main: Michael Wayne Anthony Ebanks (born 2 October 1964) is an English former footballer who played at right-back for West Bromwich Albion, Stoke City, Port Vale and Cambridge United between 1981 and 1987. He helped Port Vale to win promotion out of the Fourth Division in 1985–86. He later became a police officer.

response: Vale failed to hold on to their Third Division status, and were relegated in 1983–84. McGrath was sacked and replaced by his assistant, John Rudge, in December, who continued to name Hunter in the first eleven. He played 51 games in 1984–85, as Rudge rebuilt his team. He played 57 games in 1985–86, scoring six goals, as he helped Vale to escape the division for a second time. However Rudge signed Paul Smith and Ray Walker for the 1986–87 campaign, and Hunter played just five league games. He was given a free transfer to Wrexham in May 1987, along with teammate Wayne Ebanks.
| March 1985 || DF ||  || Wayne Ebanks || West Bromwich Albion || End of season ||

The pre-season saw John Rudge sign big defender John Williams from Tranmere Rovers for £12,000, and powerful Welsh striker Andy Jones from Northern Premier League side Rhyl for £3,000. He also signed goalkeeper Jim Arnold (Everton); Paul Maguire (Tacoma Stars); Jeff Johnson (Gillingham); and Wayne Ebanks (West Bromwich Albion). Meanwhile, new safety regulations reduced Vale Park's capacity down to 16,800, and later again to 16,300. The club set a £10 bonus for clean sheets and also set bonuses for promotion. Another late addition was Jon Bowden from Oldham Athletic for £5,000.
| June 1985 || DF ||  || Wayne Ebanks || West Bromwich Albion || Free transfer ||

On the financial side, a loss was made of £53,373. Match receipts earned £228,422, whilst the market rents raised £100,614. The bank overdraft stood at £216,453, whilst the club's total debts were £363,878. The club's shirt sponsors were Browns Transport. Both Geoff Hunter and Wayne Ebanks left on free transfers, Hunter joining Wrexham. Chairman Jim Lloyd also resigned due to his deteriorated relationship with the board. He was replaced by garage owner Bill Bell, who was one of many men to have worked on building Vale Park in the 1940s. Bell stated that he was not afraid to cut loose any deadwood.
| May 1987 || DF ||  || Wayne Ebanks || Cambridge United || Free transfer ||
*Wayne Ebanks (born 1964), English former footballer who played right-back
